basics.name: Jerome Sheed
basics.label: Architect | Engineer | Linux | Kubernetes | Cloud
basics.summary: A versatile and dedicated systems engineer with over 15 years experience in the field. From traditional system administration / engineering / architecture to DevOps, Automation, Orchestration, Config Management, Containers and everything in between.

work.name: Red Hat
work.summary: Red Hat is the leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions and the biggest enterprise Linux vendor in the world
highlights: Architecture, Consulting, OpenShift, OpenShift Data Foundation, OpenShift Advanced Cluster Management, OpenShift Advanced Cluster Security, Quay, Kubernetes, Config Management, Linux.
Architect, plan, manage and deploy customer projects.
Present and lead design workshops to onboard new OpenShift customers, elaborate on our products and determine their needs.

Implement designs / solutions based off of these findings, whilst teaching the customer about our technologies, and showing them the pain points they can eliminate in their environments. All the while, ensuring the customer has a great experience in the process.

work.name: DigiOutsource
work.summary: DigiOutsource is a global technology and e-commerce leader with 20 years in the industry, offering employees valuable international experience in the world of online gambling and advanced systems.
highlights: Automation, Orchestration, Config Management.
Plan, manage and facilitate elimination of technical debt.
Plan, manage and facilitate migration of traditional workloads to Kubernetes via means of Ansible, Terraform and CI/CD pipelines.
Mentor and provide both informal / formal training to colleagues.

work.name: Amazon Web Services
work.summary: AWS - The Largest Cloud Provider In The World. Assisting enterprise customers like - Disney, Netflix, Siemens, Shell, Amazon.com to make use of all AWS Services related to Linux.
highlights: Enterprise Escalation Point for various AWS services like EC2, EBS, EFS, SSM etc.
Developed and released internal training for other engineers on specific AWS services.
Mentored junior engineers and facilitate their grown / promotion.
Performed over 50 technical interviews and participated in numerous hiring events.
Worked with Solutions Architect Team at AWS Public Events, like re:Invent to onboard and assist new clients.

work.name: RedPixie (acquired by HPE)
work.summary: RedPixie was one of Europe’s leading cloud specialists. I built, managed and maintained one of Europe's biggest insurers (Legal And General) HPC Linux environment.
highlights: Managed and helped design and deploy, a Linux HPC Algo One Cluster (300+ VMs) in Azure.
Implemented and wrote several Puppet manifests to better control environment.
Implemented and wrote several monitoring scripts to better monitor environment.
Provided internal Linux training to staff.

work.name: RSAWeb
work.summary: RSAWEB is a South African ISP. I worked as a Cloud Engineer deploying a variety of environments. Email, hosting, virtualization, storage, DNS and anything in between
highlights: Converting of both authoritative and recursive DNS servers to PowerDNS (Linux), from mydns (FreeBSD).
Implemented Ansible to deploy and manage various client environments.
Implementing and building of ZFS arrays for slow archival storage.
Providing training and mentoring to helpdesk staff.

work.name: Marketech
work.position: Senior Technology Expert and Third Line Support
work.summary: Marketech is a company that specialises in POS systems. I worked as 3rd line Linux support for a tier 1 retail organisation (Pick n Pay). Provided support for an estate of +-7000 SUSE (SLES) machines.

work.name: RightShift (acquired by Derivco)
work.summary: Rightshift was a company that specialized in creating games for the online gambling industry. I was responsible for the management of the IT department/infrastructure.
highlights: All external services hosted through sister company moved in house: AD, Exchange, VMWare, Firewall, Storage and Asset Management.
Recruiting and training of additional IT resources.
Multiple seamless office moves.
Ansible rolled out as a config management tool of choice.
Procuring and setting up mobile charge stations for over 100 devices.

work.name: Orange Street Software
work.summary: Orange Street Software specialises in outsourced IT services for medium to enterprise businesses. Client facing and outsourced to clients on a contractual basis.
highlights: Outsourced to a leading liquor distributor (Picardi Rebel) with approximately 80 branches nationally.
I managed all aspects of their IT setup.
Project managed, architected and deployed a National POS rollout.
Implemented help desk solution.
Converted all stores to ADSL connectivity and cut billing and reliance on old equipment.
Converted old company website in to a modern CMS platform.

work.name: Solid Systems
work.summary: Solid Systems specialises in outsourced IT services for small and medium sized businesses. Roaming on-site support engineer. I visited clients on an ad-hoc and monthly basis and provided them with IT support.
highlights: This ranged from hardware / software support on a desktop level to server maintenance / administration.
I managed client expectations on-site and provided them with any IT services required. I also provided remote assistance / after hours support if required.

work.name: Adept Software
work.summary: Adept Software creates so􀈅ware catering for the logistics / courier industries.
highlights: I worked as a IT Support Engineer. My work was primarily done over the phone via the IT help desk, but I did occasionally go out on-site, in order to train and assist clients in person.
I supported and installed Adept’s software packages. These include Parcel Perfect, PPSms, PPMobile and PPImager.
Linux and SQL administration.
Backups.

references.name: Vinayak Kumar - Senior DevOps Engineer - https://www.linkedin.com/in/vinayak-kumar/
references.reference: I know a lot of Linux engineers and DevOps Practitioners - and Jerome, when it comes to Linux and DevOps, is one of the best I've met. We've worked together for common clients and aside from his skill, what I appreciate most is how reliable and responsive he is. As we worked on public cloud platforms together even though in different teams, Jerome was always keen to help and share his knowledge with rest of the team. I happily recommend him here on LinkedIn, and do so in person to my clients whenever I have the opportunity.

references.name: Daniel Koszegi - Senior Cloud Architect - https://www.linkedin.com/in/koszegi/
references.reference: Jerome always amazed me with his industry insight and original approach to solving problems. He is a powerful, knowledgeable and responsible Linux Engineer. Jerome is extremely enthusiastic about his work which is infectious. An eager professional - no matter how complex the problem is, he will always come up with a brilliant, elegant, and cost-effective solution. I could always rely on him to set the best example to the rest of the team. Absolutely someone I'd want to to have on my team.

references.name: Daniel Fiske - Technology Consultant - Private Equity - https://www.linkedin.com/in/danielfiske/

He was able to adapt his knowledge as the business evolved and always showed great commitment to the team. He was a fun member of the team who will be missed (ask him about Chairman Meow).

references.name: Daniel Avinir - CTO - https://www.linkedin.com/in/danavinir/
references.reference: Jerome is extremely passionate about IT - He loves a challenge and can think outside the box. I would happily employ him again.
